solution_line_template: First find the net amount of ivy Cary removes each day by subtracting the ivy's growth from the amount she removes: {removed_per_day} feet/day - {grows_per_night} feet/day = <<{removed_per_day}-{grows_per_night}={net_removal_per_day}>>{net_removal_per_day} feet/day

Then divide the total feet of ivy by the net amount Cary removes each day to find how many days it takes her to remove all the ivy: {total_ivy} feet / {net_removal_per_day} feet/day = <<{total_ivy}/{net_removal_per_day}={days_to_strip_ivy}>>{days_to_strip_ivy} days
